results.title: Crackpot, jackpot: Human contrasts and survival
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Botanic man”.
This program takes a look at the problems caused by the high energy consumption of modern countries and some possible solutions. It contrasts life in California, the inhabitants of a tower block who live in a completely controlled environment and the inhabitants of Mexico where Indians are farming land which is rich in oil and great changes are about to embrace them.

results.title: Botanic man
results.brief_description: An amazing 10-part series, tracing the evolution and adaptation of life on earth. The programs take a botanical point of view because it is the plants that form the basis of the energy web which enables life as we know it to exist in this world.

results.title: Life on the limit: cultivation and the environment
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Botanic man”.
Highlights the problems caused by the development of agriculture, focusing on India with the agricultural revolution in Assam which caused one of the first man-made ecological disasters. As the trees were felled to make way for cultivation, the soil was unprotected and the vital minerals were eroded from the soil by the heavy rainfall. It is an example of a paradox that has plagued almost every one of the developments modern man has achieved.

results.title: From Graz to Glenroy
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Elfrieda Senycia and Viv Mehes
results.brief_description: This story explores the journey of migration from Austria to Australia for Elfrida and her husband. As they rebuild life in a new country they deal with triumps and disappointments including the humiliation of never having their qualifications recognised in Australia.

results.title: A young girls journey to the other side of the world
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Maria Sourtzis
results.brief_description: This is a story of migration through the eyes of a young girl. Maria recounts the long journey by boat, the memories of Bonegilla migrant reception centre and her early life in Melbourne.
results.title_for_label: A young girls journey to the other side of the world

results.title: The Story of an immigrant filmmaker
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Agnes Karlik
results.brief_description: Agnes was separated from her mother and sisters when she migrated from post war Europe with her father. Her father was a filmmaker and documents their journey on the ship and their arrival to a transit camp in Western Australia. This story uses the footage captured by her father to tell her tale of migration.
results.description: Agnes was separated from her mother and sisters when she migrated from post war Europe with her father.
